Sentencas: Proton-conducting BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-delta (BZY) electrolyte is hard to sinter and the good anode material has not yet been found.
Titulo: Novel modification of anode microstructure for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ electrolytes

Sentencas: In this study, a BZY electrolyte layer is deposited using aerosol deposition (AD) method on top of a Ni-YSZ (yttria-stabilized zirconia) anode.
Titulo: Novel modification of anode microstructure for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ electrolytes

Sentencas: A novel technique using phase transformation is developed for the modification of microstructure of Ni-YSZ.
Titulo: Novel modification of anode microstructure for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ electrolytes

Sentencas: The Ni-YSZ of the anode functional layer (AFL) is transformed into Ni-BZY by heat treatment with atmospheric powder at temperature (1200 degrees C) substantially lower than the normal sintering temperature of cell fabrication.
Titulo: Novel modification of anode microstructure for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ electrolytes

Sentencas: By the reaction of BaO vapor with YSZ particles in AFL, very fine BZY particles are homogeneously formed on large Ni particles and thus largely increase the triple-phase-boundaries (TPB).
Titulo: Novel modification of anode microstructure for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ electrolytes

Sentencas: This results in a dramatic decrease of areaspecific polarization resistance (0.21 SI cm(2) at 600 degrees C) and increase of peak power density (246 mW cm(-2) at 600 degrees C) compared to those values (1.19 0 cm(2) and 84 mW cm(-2)) without the novel heat treatment.
Titulo: Novel modification of anode microstructure for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ electrolytes

Sentencas: This is one of the best performances among the reported values of cells with BZY-based electrolyte.
Titulo: Novel modification of anode microstructure for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ electrolytes
